item.title: Tsallis-Cirto entropy of black hole and black hole atom
item.description: arXiv:2409.15362v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The application of the non-extensive Tsallis-Cirto $\delta$-entropy with $\delta=2$ to the black hole suggests that the mass spectrum of the black hole is equidistant, $M=NM_0$. Here $N$ is an integer number and $M_0=\sqrt{2}m_{\rm P}$ is the mass quantum expressed via the reduced Planck mass $m_{\rm P}$. The Bekenstein-Hawking entropy of the black hole with mass $M=NM_0$ is $S_{\rm BH}(N)=N^2$.
item.dc:creator: G. E. Volovik
